metadata.unit_designation: Xxi Corpo D Armata Xxi Corps

narrative.title: Xxi Corpo D Armata Xxi Corps - 1943Q2
narrative.situation: Italian corps deployed in North Africa during 1943Q2.
narrative.objectives: XXI Corpo d'Armata was DESTROYED and non-operational in 1943-Q2. Corps had served as infantry corps for static defense during 1940-1942 Libya/Egypt campaigns. Destroyed at Second Battle of El Alamein (October-November 1942) with subordinate divisions Trento (destroyed 25 November 1942) and Bologna (largely destroyed at El Alamein). US Army G-2 Order of Battle of the Italian Army (July 1943, page 2640) confirms: 'XXI Corps - Destroyed in Tunisia, May 1943.' No tactical doctrine applies to destroyed formation.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

weather.terrain: N/A - Corps destroyed, not operational in Tunisia 1943-Q2
environmental_challenges: Corps destroyed - no environmental challenges apply
XXI Corps was destroyed at El Alamein (November 1942) and confirmed destroyed in Tunisia by May 1943
Formation did not participate in Tunisia Campaign final battles (March-May 1943)

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter
